alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:56AM EDT until July 08 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Suwanee Creek at Suwanee. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at U S Highway 23 or Buford Highway. Most of the Suwanee Creek Greenway and trails are flooded from the Suwanee Creek Park to George Pierce Park. The minor flooding will also begin to affect portions of the playground area behind the Suwanee Elementary School. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.9 feet and slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
